newsitem.title: POLAND: Slaski rebounds after Monday's drop.
newsitem.headline: Slaski rebounds after Monday's drop.

text.p: Poland's Bank Slaski SA, 54-percent controlled by ING Bank, rose 9.9 percent in active trade to 194 zlotys on Tuesday, a day after it fell by the same amount.

Traders said the drop on Monday, when Poland's lombard rate went up by two points to 27 percent and the discount rate by 2.5 points to 24.5 percent, may have been speculative or represented selling by a small amount of players.
"I think an investor may have gotten scared," one trader said.
BRE announced on Monday it would raise its deposit rates this week, BIG its credit rates.
BRE was flat on Tuesday after a fall on Monday and BIG rose 2.8 percent after staying flat on Monday.
